alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 11:23PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Jefferson and northwestern Douglas Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1122 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms near Clinton and Perry Lakes, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Valley Falls, Oskaloosa, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Ozawkie, Nortonville, Lecompton, Winchester, Williamstown, Perry Lake, Grantville and Clinton Lake. This includes Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 189 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
